data.author: Mypunt61
data.content: HUBSTER 1    -  after reading  Novamedica legal status it states - Novamedica is not a healthcare or pharmacy service provider. They operate an online marketplace that introduces patients ("Patients") to independent healthcare professionals or organisations ("Healthcare Providers. Novamedica is trading as The GPService but that doesn't confirm that they own the GPService UK  however IMO  the cause concern would still lie with the director and his continued relationship he has with Kanabo Group and the Gpservice UK since his resignation.How would this platform be financially beneficial to Kanabo shareholders and how would the revenue income be managed ?This relationship  may not have breached the Companies Act 2006 yet but any disposal of the GPService looks very  questionable. You mentioned  Levein Technologies and after an AI  Google search,it reveals the name The  Levein Group, and it states that Suleman and Kanabo Avihu have a relationship  (maybe partnership) with this company, so that name has not come out of thin air. All these findings are accessible in the public domain

data.author: Mypunt61
data.content: The subsidiary GP service has Avihu and recently appointed Sharon as registered directors at companies house .They are registered seperate from their director role status at Kanabo Group even though the out of date website displays the GP service as part of the group. From April the GP Service has  complied with the regulatory requirements at companies house with the accounts /confirmation statement to keep it running as a going concern with Sulcranie creating Novamedica platform  trading as The GP service whilst not carrying any medical liabilities possibly because the Doctors are self employed. With the Kanabo Group  IMO it looks like it has been purposely left to run into administration followed by a gaslighting Administration RNS about working alongside the administrators to look for ways to rescue the group, when in reality,in administration they have to hand over full control of the business, but does that still include the GP Service that lookss like to have been running as a solvent independent company . So the Group administration has now been registered at companies house together with late account / confirmation statement pending  whilst the GP Serviceis up to date and running. So since the temporary suspension and maybe a long time before it ,was their strategic planning aimed at protecting  the group or the gp service and their own pockets whilst screwing shareholders . If the Group survives in some capacity  and relists then we will need more than a miracle  but it looks like the GP Service has already been taken care of ,

data.author: Mypunt61
data.content: Taken from the link EU notified bodies Any mandatory third-party conformity assessment for the CE marking must be carried out by an EU notified body. This includes both EU-based notified bodies and notified bodies in countries which are listed on the EU’s NANDO information system. Certificates issued by EU-recognised notified bodies that are valid for the EU market will continue to be recognised as valid for the Great Britain market. The UK is not on the NANDOS list of EU recognised notified bodies  so cannot issue CE Mark certification but to minimise disruption post Brexit the UK will  continue to accept CE marked products for sale onto  the uk market until 2030 and overseen by MHRA .

data.author: Aimingtoplease
data.content: On 4 March 2025, the Company announced that it continues to review its strategic direction and assess the need for additional resources to develop commercial AI technology. The Company's financial position has become more uncertain over the past month. The Company is engaged in ongoing discussions regarding a potential restructuring of its business, which may involve, among other options, asset disposals, mergers, or a refocus on the Company's core business lines. The Company is also continuing to assess its capital needs and funding requirements, including potential fundraising alternatives. In light of the uncertainty regarding the Company's financial position, the Company anticipates that completion and publication of the Company's audited accounts for the year ended 31 December 2024 will be delayed. Not until this has been resolved.

data.content: I may have missed some news which explains this, so please correct me..............The GP Service website came back online, but with a lot of issues.....broken links, inaccurate info etc.   I contacted them to ask why, and received this response : "Thank you for reaching out. As such, there may be temporary issues on the website, such as broken links or outdated content, which we are actively working to resolve in the coming weeks. We appreciate your patience and understanding during this time. If you have any further questions, feel free to reach out. Warm regards, Support Team The GP Service""

data.author: hubster1
data.content: We need some traction from an investigative journalist on this one. I've emailed dan.mccrum@ft.com Not had a reply, but I'm going to keep emailing. I would suggest others do the same, and to as many journalists as you can find. My gut feel is that Kanabo knowingly overpaid massively for The GP Service, only to offload it back at a fraction of the cost.  Shareholder monies will have evaporated, and with it being offloaded under suspension I imagine the audit trail goes with it. The directors involved here all appear known to each other. I suspect the UK directors resigned when they suspected something was wrong, as they didn't want to be associated with it. What did Kanabo ever actually produce? In reality we've seen some cheap vapes that could have been produced in China. Even more interesting is their fraudulent listings here : https://treat-it.clinic/clinics/ I am very familiar with Southwold, and know the pharmacy well.   Last week their pharmacy was listed as a referral centre for Treat IT.   This week they've been removed.   I spoke with the pharmacy and they've never heard of Treat IT (as I suspected). I believe they are just rotating around pharmacies on that site, pretending they have a connection..........when in reality they have none.

data.author: hubster1
data.content: I don't have a template I'm afraid, in the sense that the emails I've sent are personal to my case / findings;  I think a personal email would be far more effective in any case. Thus far I've emailed : investgations@ft.com dan.mccrum@ft.com info@tcij.org  (centre for investigative journalism) If you're pondering what to write, I've highlighted some of the following : - The steady resignation of directors leading up to the suspension - The transfer of shares by Ian Mattioli last year, which would have enabled them to be sold without disclosing a director deal - The peculiar recent filing by Kanabo plc on companies house, containing amended 2023 accounts (in which they declare they forgot to submit paperwork which excludes The GP Service from statutory audit) - The posting on the GP Service website that it had been acquired by Novomedica (company# 16437130) whose director is Suleman SACRANIE. The same man who led Kanabo to acquire it for £14M in 2022 - The change in posting, removing that statement, and replacing it with 'Acquired by Levein Technologies Limited' whose director is a Sri Lankan individual. The company filings show no significant assets to make such an acquisition. - No RNS relating the GP Service - The appointment of Sharon Malka as a director of the GP Service during a period of suspension; Again no RNS - The GP Service themselves sending me an email to say they no longer have an association with Kanabo - No update on the Kanabo website, which still shows the GP Service association and a link to it - The Treat IT website references pharmacies which have no knowledge of their service - Kanabo products have been unavailable for months at any sales outlet - Avihu Tamir has stopped posting on any forum, including Linkedin, and there is no response from his email addresses - No response from my emails to their NOMAD Peterhouse Capital (and I have their director's email, who has responded once in the past) - No response from my email to their auditor MHA. They were in the news this year for audit failures, which doesn't inspire confidence https://www.cityam.com/mha-watchdog-opens-probe-over-audits-of-folded-construction-firm/ I could go on - The thing that will get this traction is personal impact stories, so I'd encourage you to share your situation with as many journalists as you can.

data.content: For me the most interesting thing to happen recently is that Avihu Tamir has broken his LinkedIn radio silence.........last week he was promoting a General Manager position for Telehealth...........no doubt rising from the ashes, funded by shareholders. "About the job Role: General Manager, UK Telehealth Clinic, Medical Cannabis (CBPMs) Location: UK (remote) Compensation: £90,000 base + up to £30,000 bonus (OTE £120,000) The opportunity We are looking for a commercially sharp, credible healthcare leader to take full ownership of a CQC-registered telehealth clinic at a pivotal moment in its journey. This is a rare chance to put your stamp on a healthcare business at exactly the right moment. You will have the backing of an experienced global group, the autonomy to lead locally, and the mandate to build something credible, compliant, and profitable from the ground up. data.author: Mypunt61
data.content: The subsidiary GP service has Avihu and recently appointed Sharon as registered directors at companies house .They are registered seperate from their director role status at Kanabo Group even though the out of date website displays the GP service as part of the group. From April the GP Service has  complied with the regulatory requirements at companies house with the accounts /confirmation statement to keep it running as a going concern with Sulcranie creating Novamedica platform  trading as The GP service whilst not carrying any medical liabilities possibly because the Doctors are self employed. With the Kanabo Group  IMO it looks like it has been purposely left to run into administration followed by a gaslighting Administration RNS about working alongside the administrators to look for ways to rescue the group, when in reality,in administration they have to hand over full control of the business, but does that still include the GP Service that lookss like to have been running as a solvent independent company . So the Group administration has now been registered at companies house together with late account / confirmation statement pending  whilst the GP Serviceis up to date and running. So since the temporary suspension and maybe a long time before it ,was their strategic planning aimed at protecting  the group or the gp service and their own pockets whilst screwing shareholders . If the Group survives in some capacity  and relists then we will need more than a miracle  but it looks like the GP Service has already been taken care of ,

data.author: Mypunt61
data.content: Taken from the link EU notified bodies Any mandatory third-party conformity assessment for the CE marking must be carried out by an EU notified body. This includes both EU-based notified bodies and notified bodies in countries which are listed on the EU’s NANDO information system. Certificates issued by EU-recognised notified bodies that are valid for the EU market will continue to be recognised as valid for the Great Britain market. The UK is not on the NANDOS list of EU recognised notified bodies  so cannot issue CE Mark certification but to minimise disruption post Brexit the UK will  continue to accept CE marked products for sale onto  the uk market until 2030 and overseen by MHRA .

data.author: Aimingtoplease
data.content: On 4 March 2025, the Company announced that it continues to review its strategic direction and assess the need for additional resources to develop commercial AI technology. The Company's financial position has become more uncertain over the past month. The Company is engaged in ongoing discussions regarding a potential restructuring of its business, which may involve, among other options, asset disposals, mergers, or a refocus on the Company's core business lines. The Company is also continuing to assess its capital needs and funding requirements, including potential fundraising alternatives. In light of the uncertainty regarding the Company's financial position, the Company anticipates that completion and publication of the Company's audited accounts for the year ended 31 December 2024 will be delayed. Not until this has been resolved.

data.author: hubster1
data.content: I don't have a template I'm afraid, in the sense that the emails I've sent are personal to my case / findings;  I think a personal email would be far more effective in any case. Thus far I've emailed : investgations@ft.com dan.mccrum@ft.com info@tcij.org  (centre for investigative journalism) If you're pondering what to write, I've highlighted some of the following : - The steady resignation of directors leading up to the suspension - The transfer of shares by Ian Mattioli last year, which would have enabled them to be sold without disclosing a director deal - The peculiar recent filing by Kanabo plc on companies house, containing amended 2023 accounts (in which they declare they forgot to submit paperwork which excludes The GP Service from statutory audit) - The posting on the GP Service website that it had been acquired by Novomedica (company# 16437130) whose director is Suleman SACRANIE. The same man who led Kanabo to acquire it for £14M in 2022 - The change in posting, removing that statement, and replacing it with 'Acquired by Levein Technologies Limited' whose director is a Sri Lankan individual. The company filings show no significant assets to make such an acquisition. - No RNS relating the GP Service - The appointment of Sharon Malka as a director of the GP Service during a period of suspension; Again no RNS - The GP Service themselves sending me an email to say they no longer have an association with Kanabo - No update on the Kanabo website, which still shows the GP Service association and a link to it - The Treat IT website references pharmacies which have no knowledge of their service - Kanabo products have been unavailable for months at any sales outlet - Avihu Tamir has stopped posting on any forum, including Linkedin, and there is no response from his email addresses - No response from my emails to their NOMAD Peterhouse Capital (and I have their director's email, who has responded once in the past) - No response from my email to their auditor MHA. They were in the news this year for audit failures, which doesn't inspire confidence https://www.cityam.com/mha-watchdog-opens-probe-over-audits-of-folded-construction-firm/ I could go on - The thing that will get this traction is personal impact stories, so I'd encourage you to share your situation with as many journalists as you can.

data.content: We need some traction from an investigative journalist on this one. I've emailed dan.mccrum@ft.com Not had a reply, but I'm going to keep emailing. I would suggest others do the same, and to as many journalists as you can find. My gut feel is that Kanabo knowingly overpaid massively for The GP Service, only to offload it back at a fraction of the cost.  Shareholder monies will have evaporated, and with it being offloaded under suspension I imagine the audit trail goes with it. The directors involved here all appear known to each other. Last week their pharmacy was listed as a referral centre for Treat IT.   This week they've been removed.   I spoke with the pharmacy and they've never heard of Treat IT (as I suspected). I believe they are just rotating around pharmacies on that site, pretending they have a connection..........when in reality they have none.

data.author: hubster1
data.content: I may have missed some news which explains this, so please correct me..............The GP Service website came back online, but with a lot of issues.....broken links, inaccurate info etc.   I contacted them to ask why, and received this response : "Thank you for reaching out. Please note that thegpservice.co.uk website and primary care brand is no longer affiliated with Kanabo Group PLC. For any matters related to Kanabo or its medical cannabis services, we kindly direct you to the following websites: Kanabo Group (Corporate Site): https://www.kanabogroup.com/ Treat-It Clinic (Medical Cannabis Clinic): https://treat-it.clinic For direct inquiries, please feel free to contact Avihu Tamir, CEO of Kanabo Group, using either of the following emails: avihu@kanabogroup.com avihu @treat -it.clinic Kanabo Office Addresses: Israel: Kanabo Research LTD, HaBarzel St. 21a, Tel Aviv 6971029, Israel UK: Churchill House, 137-139 Brent Street, London NW4 4DJ, United Kingdom Please also note that thegpservice.co.uk is currently in a transition phase as we evolve the brand into a broader healthcare marketplace. As such, there may be temporary issues on the website, such as broken links or outdated content, which we are actively working to resolve in the coming weeks. We appreciate your patience and understanding during this time. If you have any further questions, feel free to reach out. Warm regards, Support Team The GP Service""

data.author: hubster1
data.content: I don't have a template I'm afraid, in the sense that the emails I've sent are personal to my case / findings;  I think a personal email would be far more effective in any case. Thus far I've emailed : investgations@ft.com dan.mccrum@ft.com info@tcij.org  (centre for investigative journalism) If you're pondering what to write, I've highlighted some of the following : - The steady resignation of directors leading up to the suspension - The transfer of shares by Ian Mattioli last year, which would have enabled them to be sold without disclosing a director deal - The peculiar recent filing by Kanabo plc on companies house, containing amended 2023 accounts (in which they declare they forgot to submit paperwork which excludes The GP Service from statutory audit) - The posting on the GP Service website that it had been acquired by Novomedica (company# 16437130) whose director is Suleman SACRANIE. The same man who led Kanabo to acquire it for £14M in 2022 - The change in posting, removing that statement, and replacing it with 'Acquired by Levein Technologies Limited' whose director is a Sri Lankan individual. The company filings show no significant assets to make such an acquisition. - No RNS relating the GP Service - The appointment of Sharon Malka as a director of the GP Service during a period of suspension; Again no RNS - The GP Service themselves sending me an email to say they no longer have an association with Kanabo - No update on the Kanabo website, which still shows the GP Service association and a link to it - The Treat IT website references pharmacies which have no knowledge of their service - Kanabo products have been unavailable for months at any sales outlet - Avihu Tamir has stopped posting on any forum, including Linkedin, and there is no response from his email addresses - No response from my emails to their NOMAD Peterhouse Capital (and I have their director's email, who has responded once in the past) - No response from my email to their auditor MHA. They were in the news this year for audit failures, which doesn't inspire confidence https://www.cityam.com/mha-watchdog-opens-probe-over-audits-of-folded-construction-firm/ I could go on - The thing that will get this traction is personal impact stories, so I'd encourage you to share your situation with as many journalists as you can.

data.author: hubster1
data.content: We need some traction from an investigative journalist on this one. I've emailed dan.mccrum@ft.com Not had a reply, but I'm going to keep emailing. I would suggest others do the same, and to as many journalists as you can find. My gut feel is that Kanabo knowingly overpaid massively for The GP Service, only to offload it back at a fraction of the cost.  Shareholder monies will have evaporated, and with it being offloaded under suspension I imagine the audit trail goes with it. The directors involved here all appear known to each other. I suspect the UK directors resigned when they suspected something was wrong, as they didn't want to be associated with it. What did Kanabo ever actually produce? In reality we've seen some cheap vapes that could have been produced in China. Even more interesting is their fraudulent listings here : https://treat-it.clinic/clinics/ I am very familiar with Southwold, and know the pharmacy well.   Last week their pharmacy was listed as a referral centre for Treat IT.   This week they've been removed.   I spoke with the pharmacy and they've never heard of Treat IT (as I suspected). I believe they are just rotating around pharmacies on that site, pretending they have a connection..........when in reality they have none.

As such, there may be temporary issues on the website, such as broken links or outdated content, which we are actively working to resolve in the coming weeks. data.author: hubster1
data.content: I don't have a template I'm afraid, in the sense that the emails I've sent are personal to my case / findings;  I think a personal email would be far more effective in any case. Thus far I've emailed : investgations@ft.com dan.mccrum@ft.com info@tcij.org  (centre for investigative journalism) If you're pondering what to write, I've highlighted some of the following : - The steady resignation of directors leading up to the suspension - The transfer of shares by Ian Mattioli last year, which would have enabled them to be sold without disclosing a director deal - The peculiar recent filing by Kanabo plc on companies house, containing amended 2023 accounts (in which they declare they forgot to submit paperwork which excludes The GP Service from statutory audit) - The posting on the GP Service website that it had been acquired by Novomedica (company# 16437130) whose director is Suleman SACRANIE. The same man who led Kanabo to acquire it for £14M in 2022 - The change in posting, removing that statement, and replacing it with 'Acquired by Levein Technologies Limited' whose director is a Sri Lankan individual. The company filings show no significant assets to make such an acquisition. - No RNS relating the GP Service - The appointment of Sharon Malka as a director of the GP Service during a period of suspension; Again no RNS - The GP Service themselves sending me an email to say they no longer have an association with Kanabo - No update on the Kanabo website, which still shows the GP Service association and a link to it - The Treat IT website references pharmacies which have no knowledge of their service - Kanabo products have been unavailable for months at any sales outlet - Avihu Tamir has stopped posting on any forum, including Linkedin, and there is no response from his email addresses - No response from my emails to their NOMAD Peterhouse Capital (and I have their director's email, who has responded once in the past) - No response from my email to their auditor MHA. They were in the news this year for audit failures, which doesn't inspire confidence https://www.cityam.com/mha-watchdog-opens-probe-over-audits-of-folded-construction-firm/ I could go on - The thing that will get this traction is personal impact stories, so I'd encourage you to share your situation with as many journalists as you can.

data.author: hubster1
data.content: We need some traction from an investigative journalist on this one. I've emailed dan.mccrum@ft.com Not had a reply, but I'm going to keep emailing. I would suggest others do the same, and to as many journalists as you can find. My gut feel is that Kanabo knowingly overpaid massively for The GP Service, only to offload it back at a fraction of the cost.  Shareholder monies will have evaporated, and with it being offloaded under suspension I imagine the audit trail goes with it. The directors involved here all appear known to each other. I suspect the UK directors resigned when they suspected something was wrong, as they didn't want to be associated with it. What did Kanabo ever actually produce? In reality we've seen some cheap vapes that could have been produced in China. Even more interesting is their fraudulent listings here : https://treat-it.clinic/clinics/ I am very familiar with Southwold, and know the pharmacy well.   Last week their pharmacy was listed as a referral centre for Treat IT.   This week they've been removed.   I spoke with the pharmacy and they've never heard of Treat IT (as I suspected). I believe they are just rotating around pharmacies on that site, pretending they have a connection..........when in reality they have none.

data.author: hubster1
data.content: I may have missed some news which explains this, so please correct me..............The GP Service website came back online, but with a lot of issues.....broken links, inaccurate info etc.   I contacted them to ask why, and received this response : "Thank you for reaching out. Please note that thegpservice.co.uk website and primary care brand is no longer affiliated with Kanabo Group PLC. For any matters related to Kanabo or its medical cannabis services, we kindly direct you to the following websites: Kanabo Group (Corporate Site): https://www.kanabogroup.com/ Treat-It Clinic (Medical Cannabis Clinic): https://treat-it.clinic For direct inquiries, please feel free to contact Avihu Tamir, CEO of Kanabo Group, using either of the following emails: avihu@kanabogroup.com avihu @treat -it.clinic Kanabo Office Addresses: Israel: Kanabo Research LTD, HaBarzel St. 21a, Tel Aviv 6971029, Israel UK: Churchill House, 137-139 Brent Street, London NW4 4DJ, United Kingdom Please also note that thegpservice.co.uk is currently in a transition phase as we evolve the brand into a broader healthcare marketplace. As such, there may be temporary issues on the website, such as broken links or outdated content, which we are actively working to resolve in the coming weeks. We appreciate your patience and understanding during this time. If you have any further questions, feel free to reach out. Warm regards, Support Team The GP Service""

data.author: hubster1
data.content: I don't have a template I'm afraid, in the sense that the emails I've sent are personal to my case / findings;  I think a personal email would be far more effective in any case. Thus far I've emailed : investgations@ft.com dan.mccrum@ft.com info@tcij.org  (centre for investigative journalism) If you're pondering what to write, I've highlighted some of the following : - The steady resignation of directors leading up to the suspension - The transfer of shares by Ian Mattioli last year, which would have enabled them to be sold without disclosing a director deal - The peculiar recent filing by Kanabo plc on companies house, containing amended 2023 accounts (in which they declare they forgot to submit paperwork which excludes The GP Service from statutory audit) - The posting on the GP Service website that it had been acquired by Novomedica (company# 16437130) whose director is Suleman SACRANIE. The same man who led Kanabo to acquire it for £14M in 2022 - The change in posting, removing that statement, and replacing it with 'Acquired by Levein Technologies Limited' whose director is a Sri Lankan individual. The company filings show no significant assets to make such an acquisition. - No RNS relating the GP Service - The appointment of Sharon Malka as a director of the GP Service during a period of suspension; Again no RNS - The GP Service themselves sending me an email to say they no longer have an association with Kanabo - No update on the Kanabo website, which still shows the GP Service association and a link to it - The Treat IT website references pharmacies which have no knowledge of their service - Kanabo products have been unavailable for months at any sales outlet - Avihu Tamir has stopped posting on any forum, including Linkedin, and there is no response from his email addresses - No response from my emails to their NOMAD Peterhouse Capital (and I have their director's email, who has responded once in the past) - No response from my email to their auditor MHA. They were in the news this year for audit failures, which doesn't inspire confidence https://www.cityam.com/mha-watchdog-opens-probe-over-audits-of-folded-construction-firm/ I could go on - The thing that will get this traction is personal impact stories, so I'd encourage you to share your situation with as many journalists as you can.

data.author: hubster1
data.content: We need some traction from an investigative journalist on this one. I've emailed dan.mccrum@ft.com Not had a reply, but I'm going to keep emailing. I would suggest others do the same, and to as many journalists as you can find. My gut feel is that Kanabo knowingly overpaid massively for The GP Service, only to offload it back at a fraction of the cost.  Shareholder monies will have evaporated, and with it being offloaded under suspension I imagine the audit trail goes with it. The directors involved here all appear known to each other. I suspect the UK directors resigned when they suspected something was wrong, as they didn't want to be associated with it. What did Kanabo ever actually produce? In reality we've seen some cheap vapes that could have been produced in China. Even more interesting is their fraudulent listings here : https://treat-it.clinic/clinics/ I am very familiar with Southwold, and know the pharmacy well. data.author: hubster1
data.content: I don't have a template I'm afraid, in the sense that the emails I've sent are personal to my case / findings;  I think a personal email would be far more effective in any case. Thus far I've emailed : investgations@ft.com dan.mccrum@ft.com info@tcij.org  (centre for investigative journalism) If you're pondering what to write, I've highlighted some of the following : - The steady resignation of directors leading up to the suspension - The transfer of shares by Ian Mattioli last year, which would have enabled them to be sold without disclosing a director deal - The peculiar recent filing by Kanabo plc on companies house, containing amended 2023 accounts (in which they declare they forgot to submit paperwork which excludes The GP Service from statutory audit) - The posting on the GP Service website that it had been acquired by Novomedica (company# 16437130) whose director is Suleman SACRANIE. The same man who led Kanabo to acquire it for £14M in 2022 - The change in posting, removing that statement, and replacing it with 'Acquired by Levein Technologies Limited' whose director is a Sri Lankan individual. The company filings show no significant assets to make such an acquisition. - No RNS relating the GP Service - The appointment of Sharon Malka as a director of the GP Service during a period of suspension; Again no RNS - The GP Service themselves sending me an email to say they no longer have an association with Kanabo - No update on the Kanabo website, which still shows the GP Service association and a link to it - The Treat IT website references pharmacies which have no knowledge of their service - Kanabo products have been unavailable for months at any sales outlet - Avihu Tamir has stopped posting on any forum, including Linkedin, and there is no response from his email addresses - No response from my emails to their NOMAD Peterhouse Capital (and I have their director's email, who has responded once in the past) - No response from my email to their auditor MHA. They were in the news this year for audit failures, which doesn't inspire confidence https://www.cityam.com/mha-watchdog-opens-probe-over-audits-of-folded-construction-firm/ I could go on - The thing that will get this traction is personal impact stories, so I'd encourage you to share your situation with as many journalists as you can.

My gut feel is that Kanabo knowingly overpaid massively for The GP Service, only to offload it back at a fraction of the cost.  Shareholder monies will have evaporated, and with it being offloaded under suspension I imagine the audit trail goes with it. The directors involved here all appear known to each other. I suspect the UK directors resigned when they suspected something was wrong, as they didn't want to be associated with it. What did Kanabo ever actually produce? In reality we've seen some cheap vapes that could have been produced in China. Even more interesting is their fraudulent listings here : https://treat-it.clinic/clinics/ I am very familiar with Southwold, and know the pharmacy well.   Last week their pharmacy was listed as a referral centre for Treat IT.   This week they've been removed.   I spoke with the pharmacy and they've never heard of Treat IT (as I suspected). I believe they are just rotating around pharmacies on that site, pretending they have a connection..........when in reality they have none.

data.author: hubster1
data.content: I don't have a template I'm afraid, in the sense that the emails I've sent are personal to my case / findings;  I think a personal email would be far more effective in any case. Thus far I've emailed : investgations@ft.com dan.mccrum@ft.com info@tcij.org  (centre for investigative journalism) If you're pondering what to write, I've highlighted some of the following : - The steady resignation of directors leading up to the suspension - The transfer of shares by Ian Mattioli last year, which would have enabled them to be sold without disclosing a director deal - The peculiar recent filing by Kanabo plc on companies house, containing amended 2023 accounts (in which they declare they forgot to submit paperwork which excludes The GP Service from statutory audit) - The posting on the GP Service website that it had been acquired by Novomedica (company# 16437130) whose director is Suleman SACRANIE. The same man who led Kanabo to acquire it for £14M in 2022 - The change in posting, removing that statement, and replacing it with 'Acquired by Levein Technologies Limited' whose director is a Sri Lankan individual. The company filings show no significant assets to make such an acquisition. - No RNS relating the GP Service - The appointment of Sharon Malka as a director of the GP Service during a period of suspension; Again no RNS - The GP Service themselves sending me an email to say they no longer have an association with Kanabo - No update on the Kanabo website, which still shows the GP Service association and a link to it - The Treat IT website references pharmacies which have no knowledge of their service - Kanabo products have been unavailable for months at any sales outlet - Avihu Tamir has stopped posting on any forum, including Linkedin, and there is no response from his email addresses - No response from my emails to their NOMAD Peterhouse Capital (and I have their director's email, who has responded once in the past) - No response from my email to their auditor MHA. They were in the news this year for audit failures, which doesn't inspire confidence https://www.cityam.com/mha-watchdog-opens-probe-over-audits-of-folded-construction-firm/ I could go on - The thing that will get this traction is personal impact stories, so I'd encourage you to share your situation with as many journalists as you can.

data.thread_title: RE: What is the real story here?

data.author: hubster1
data.content: We need some traction from an investigative journalist on this one. I've emailed dan.mccrum@ft.com Not had a reply, but I'm going to keep emailing. I would suggest others do the same, and to as many journalists as you can find. My gut feel is that Kanabo knowingly overpaid massively for The GP Service, only to offload it back at a fraction of the cost.  Shareholder monies will have evaporated, and with it being offloaded under suspension I imagine the audit trail goes with it. The directors involved here all appear known to each other. I suspect the UK directors resigned when they suspected something was wrong, as they didn't want to be associated with it. What did Kanabo ever actually produce? In reality we've seen some cheap vapes that could have been produced in China. Even more interesting is their fraudulent listings here : https://treat-it.clinic/clinics/ I am very familiar with Southwold, and know the pharmacy well.   Last week their pharmacy was listed as a referral centre for Treat IT.   This week they've been removed.   I spoke with the pharmacy and they've never heard of Treat IT (as I suspected). I believe they are just rotating around pharmacies on that site, pretending they have a connection..........when in reality they have none.

data.author: hubster1
data.content: I may have missed some news which explains this, so please correct me..............The GP Service website came back online, but with a lot of issues.....broken links, inaccurate info etc.   I contacted them to ask why, and received this response : "Thank you for reaching out. Please note that thegpservice.co.uk website and primary care brand is no longer affiliated with Kanabo Group PLC. For any matters related to Kanabo or its medical cannabis services, we kindly direct you to the following websites: Kanabo Group (Corporate Site): https://www.kanabogroup.com/ Treat-It Clinic (Medical Cannabis Clinic): https://treat-it.clinic For direct inquiries, please feel free to contact Avihu Tamir, CEO of Kanabo Group, using either of the following emails: avihu@kanabogroup.com avihu @treat -it.clinic Kanabo Office Addresses: Israel: Kanabo Research LTD, HaBarzel St. 21a, Tel Aviv 6971029, Israel UK: Churchill House, 137-139 Brent Street, London NW4 4DJ, United Kingdom Please also note that thegpservice.co.uk is currently in a transition phase as we evolve the brand into a broader healthcare marketplace. As such, there may be temporary issues on the website, such as broken links or outdated content, which we are actively working to resolve in the coming weeks. We appreciate your patience and understanding during this time. If you have any further questions, feel free to reach out. Warm regards, Support Team The GP Service""

data.author: hubster1
data.content: For me the most interesting thing to happen recently is that Avihu Tamir has broken his LinkedIn radio silence.........last week he was promoting a General Manager position for Telehealth...........no doubt rising from the ashes, funded by shareholders. "About the job Role: General Manager, UK Telehealth Clinic, Medical Cannabis (CBPMs) Location: UK (remote) Compensation: £90,000 base + up to £30,000 bonus (OTE £120,000) The opportunity We are looking for a commercially sharp, credible healthcare leader to take full ownership of a CQC-registered telehealth clinic at a pivotal moment in its journey. This is a rare chance to put your stamp on a healthcare business at exactly the right moment. You will have the backing of an experienced global group, the autonomy to lead locally, and the mandate to build something credible, compliant, and profitable from the ground up. The clinic has recently been acquired by a highly successful international telehealth group and now needs a Country General Manager who can stabilise, rebuild, and grow the operation with confidence, pace, and rigour. If you thrive in regulated environments and want the authority to shape outcomes rather than manage symptoms, this role is for you. In your first year, you will: Stabilise the business post-acquisition and restore confidence with regulators, clinicians, suppliers, and patients Shape a compliant operating model that is ready to scale Take full ownership of financial performance and drive the business to sustainable profitability Build a commercially disciplined growth engine with controlled patient acquisition costs Lead and align clinical and non-clinical teams around clear goals and accountability This is a hands-on leadership role. data.author: Mypunt61
data.content: Looking through the fillings of Kanabo GP Limited it may have been set up as a creditor with the Maven  Income & Growth having significant control from 21/2/22 previously held by the Kanabo Group . Maven Growth were significant holders of the GP Service before the Kanabo Group acquisition. It looks like as a result of the recent sale of the GP Service, the undisclosed fee will be heading back to Kanabo GP Ltd. If this is true then it does not look good for Kanabo Group shareholders whilst Avihu and Sharon are directors of Kanabo GP Limited. Emails to HL and II may inform of the administration but looking back on all the delayed disclosures  before the GP Service acquisition by the Kanabo Group , there were proections in place for Maven Income & Growth and nothing for Kanabo Group shareholders,and all we have is Avihu gaslighting about efforts in this administration to save the company but don't hold your breath.

data.author: Mypunt61
data.content: I share the same belief and the official sale of the GP Service looks as though it was a planned pre pack administration disposal with a buyer already on standby. Their out of date website still has direct links to the GPService/Treat it clinic despite the rapid sale being officially RNS  announced. Ive also noticed that Kanabo GP Limited ,(I believe is another subsidiary of the Kanabo Group) interestingly, has had some recent activity at Companies House but where that leads to is still a mystery but still worth watching .Let's see what happens and if they are really looking for a way to return and relist !!

data.author: Adriansmith
data.content: The board of Kanabo Group plc has announced that the company has been placed into administration from 28 November 2025 and have appointed administrators. The company’s shares were previously suspended from trading on the London Stock Exchange on 1 May 2025. Once the company confirms further information, for instance an intention to either delist or distribute any potential proceeds following completion of the administration process, we will contact you again with more details.

data.author: Mypunt61
data.content: So its now official that the disposal sale has now been completed and ACQUIRED by another company  but according to the website it was  previously ACQUIRED by Novamedica, so does Sulcranie get his share of the undisclosed fee paid ? What happens to the Treat IT clinic ? It was powered  by the GP Service  and is still functioning? The partnership with British  Cannabis is also powered by the GP Service So if the administrators are now looking at strategic ways to save the business, will this recent disposal transaction end the support between GP Service and Treat It clinic/British Cannabis partnership? IMO the rapid disposal still looks suspicious due to the previous actions with Novimedica etc and what if any assets are still viable as a going concern and if so, what delayed accounts are now submitted to companies house after this disposal.

data.author: Mypunt61
data.content: There's a very slim chance that  alls not lost yet, but that depends on what plan if any, is put to creditors. They would need to appoint new auditors and submit their late accounts. The resignation of their last auditors MHA was due to a reorganisation, and that was supported by a letter to address possible creditors concerns . I'm just trying to cling on to some hope but not sure what that will translate into as I feel like we've been scammed .Maybe if Trump finally reschedules cannabis it will make the path clearer

data.author: Mypunt61
data.content: The subsidiary GP service has Avihu and recently appointed Sharon as registered directors at companies house .They are registered seperate from their director role status at Kanabo Group even though the out of date website displays the GP service as part of the group. From April the GP Service has  complied with the regulatory requirements at companies house with the accounts /confirmation statement to keep it running as a going concern with Sulcranie creating Novamedica platform  trading as The GP service whilst not carrying any medical liabilities possibly because the Doctors are self employed. With the Kanabo Group  IMO it looks like it has been purposely left to run into administration followed by a gaslighting Administration RNS about working alongside the administrators to look for ways to rescue the group, when in reality,in administration they have to hand over full control of the business, but does that still include the GP Service that lookss like to have been running as a solvent independent company . So the Group administration has now been registered at companies house together with late account / confirmation statement pending  whilst the GP Serviceis up to date and running. So since the temporary suspension and maybe a long time before it ,was their strategic planning aimed at protecting  the group or the gp service and their own pockets whilst screwing shareholders . If the Group survives in some capacity  and relists then we will need more than a miracle  but it looks like the GP Service has already been taken care of ,

They have possibly got  threats from creditors wanting returns and I can see the GPService could be part of the asset strip  but will that be a surprise . Maybe Mr Novamedica will own it again
